intro: Rosa corymbifera var. wichurae, commonly known as the Wichura rose, is a cultivar of the shrub rose native to China. It is characterized by its fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. Its foliage provides a dense canopy, making it suitable for hedging or as a decorative shrub in gardens. The botanical features of this variety make it both ornamental and adaptable to a range of soil conditions.
